results.title: Sunday in Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Melbourne Repertory Film Unit, State Film Centre of Victoria, Gil Brealey and Paul Olson
results.brief_description: An experiment in the creative use of colour visuals, natural sound and dialogue commentary, this film shows the loneliness of the aimless wanderers in the city streets contrasted with those who have companionship on their Sunday. (Award: Special Award for an Experimental Film in the Australian Film Awards, Melbourne Film Festival, 1958) Rights held by Gil Brealey.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Melbourne Repertory Film Unit, State Film Centre of Victoria, Gil Brealey and Paul Olson

results.title: Glenn's story
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Sue Dunstan and Arnold Zable
results.brief_description: A documentary based on a story written by a 15 year old boy in the maximum security section of Turana. Discusses his childhood and the events which eventually lead to his becoming a ward of the state and finding himself on the wrong side of the law.

results.title: A Bridge in music
results.creator_credit: Unesco, Alexander Shaw and Muir Mathieson
results.brief_description: Yehudi Menuhin and Eastern musician Ayana Deva Angadi compare Eastern and Western music and discuss how we can come to understand and appreciate that which is foreign to us in terms of that which is familiar. Characteristic techniques are shown, and the film includes examples of music from India, Japan, Cambodia, Italy, Germany and France.

results.title: The Melbourne Concert Hall
results.creator_credit: Kestrel Films (Australia), The Victorian Arts Centre, David Morgan and David Greig
results.brief_description: Interviews with architects, administrators, interior designers, construction workers and others associated with the construction of the Melbourne Concert Hall. Artists who have performed at the venue also give their opinion of hall. Those interviewed include: Roy Ground, Neil Haysom, Theodore Schultz, Ken Myer, John Truscott and Kenny Christophers. Shows segments from performances by Jackie Love, Cleo Laine, Sylvio Gualdo, Karen Knowles, London Early Music Group, Mondo Rock, the guitarist John Williams, Brian May’s Melbourne Showband and conductors Piero Gamba, Patrick Thomas and John Hopkins. Views of Melbourne’s skyline capture the Gas and Fuel buildings that were demolished to accommodate Federation Square.

results.title: Northern oasis
results.creator_credit: Boort Progress Association and E.M. Jackson
results.brief_description:
A silent film about life in the North-Western Victorian country town of Boort during the 1940s. Produced by and for the people of Boort and district.
The Loddon Weir is shown, as are: local livestock sales, dairy, poultry, pork and citrus farming, school children at the small local school and Australia Day celebrations with athletics, a fashion parade, tennis, lawn bowls and decorative boat river regatta. The film ends with the “Water - the life-blood of the North. The future progress and prosperity of this Northern-Oasis depend upon its assured supply.”

results.title: The Last coastline
results.creator_credit: Arkaba Films, South Australian Film Corporation, Jack Hume and G Turney-Smith
results.brief_description: In 1802, Captain Matthew Flinders explored and charted the last unknown coastline on Earth. We see this magnificent coastline as Flinders saw it, recreating his journey with the help of the record in his ship’s log. The coastline is that of Eyre Peninsula, South Australia - a coastline that has been barely touched by man. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: On the ball (1st Version)
results.brief_description: A humorous commentary on the game of Australian football. Go there, see it all. The screams, the advice, friendly admonitions. An analysis of the various aspects of Australian Rules Football spectatorship.

results.title: At the Land's End: the Wilson's Promontory National Park
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria, Parks Victoria, Wilson's Promontory Committee of Management and David Swift
results.brief_description: This film shows the breathtaking landscape, the wildlife and the facilities for holiday-makers at Tidal River. The work of the ranger is described and there are two outstanding sequences dealing with the Smoking Cliffs at Darby River and gannets diving off Five-Mile Beach. Narrated by Wynn Roberts.
